Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the depicted object is not a Tiffany-made slave collar and is not on display at the National Museum of African American History and Culture in Washington, D.C.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misinterpretation of the photograph and the text of the exhibit.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photograph depicts a Tiffany-made slave collar, which is not supported by evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the collar is part of the collection of artifacts from the slave trade at the Lest We Forget Black Holocaust Slavery Museum in Philadelphia.
